entries.name: FAST
entries.desc: flag for new and open. this flag is obsolete for gdbm >= 1.8

entries.name: NEWDB
entries.desc: open database as a writer; overwrite any existing databases

entries.name: NOLOCK
entries.desc: flag for new and open

entries.name: READER
entries.desc: open database as a reader

entries.name: SYNC
entries.desc: flag for new and open. only for gdbm >= 1.8

entries.name: VERSION
entries.desc: version of the gdbm library

entries.name: WRCREAT
entries.desc: open database as a writer; if the database does not exist, create a new one

entries.name: WRITER
entries.desc: open database as a writer

entries.name: new(filename, mode = 0666, flags = nil)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new GDBM instance by opening a gdbm file named filename. If the file does not exist, a new file with file mode mode will be created. flags may be one of the following:

entries.name: open(filename, mode = 0666, flags = nil)click to toggle source
gdbm[key] → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Retrieves the value corresponding to key.

entries.name: gdbm[key]= value → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Associates the value value with the specified key.

entries.name: cachesize = size → sizeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the size of the internal bucket cache to size.

entries.name: clear → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Removes all the key-value pairs within gdbm.

entries.name: close → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Closes the associated database file.

entries.name: closed?  → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the associated database file has been closed.

entries.name: delete(key) → value or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Removes the key-value-pair with the specified key from this database and returns the corresponding value. Returns nil if the database is empty.

entries.name: delete_if { |key, value| block } → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes every key-value pair from gdbm for which block evaluates to true.

entries.name: each_pair { |key, value| block } → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Executes block for each key in the database, passing the key and the corresponding value as a parameter.

entries.name: each_key { |key| block } → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Executes block for each key in the database, passing the key as a parameter.

entries.name: each_pair { |key, value| block } → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Executes block for each key in the database, passing the key and the corresponding value as a parameter.

entries.name: each_value { |value| block } → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Executes block for each key in the database, passing the corresponding value as a parameter.

entries.name: empty? → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database is empty.

entries.name: fastmode = boolean → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Turns the database's fast mode on or off. If fast mode is turned on, gdbm does not wait for writes to be flushed to the disk before continuing.

entries.name: fetch(key [, default]) → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Retrieves the value corresponding to key. If there is no value associated with key, default will be returned instead.

entries.name: has_key?(k) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given key k exists within the database. Returns false otherwise.

entries.name: has_value?(v) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given value v exists within the database. Returns false otherwise.

entries.name: include?(k) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given key k exists within the database. Returns false otherwise.

entries.name: invert  → hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash created by using gdbm's values as keys, and the keys as values.

entries.name: key(value) → keyclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the key for a given value. If several keys may map to the same value, the key that is found first will be returned.

entries.name: key?(k) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given key k exists within the database. Returns false otherwise.

entries.name: keys → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array of all keys of this database.

entries.name: length → fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the number of key-value pairs in this database.

entries.name: member?(k) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given key k exists within the database. Returns false otherwise.

entries.name: reject { |key, value| block } → hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash copy of gdbm where all key-value pairs from gdbm for which block evaluates to true are removed. See also: delete_if

entries.name: reject! { |key, value| block } → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes every key-value pair from gdbm for which block evaluates to true.

entries.name: reorganize → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Reorganizes the database file. This operation removes reserved space of elements that have already been deleted. It is only useful after a lot of deletions in the database.

entries.name: replace(other) → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Replaces the content of gdbm with the key-value pairs of other. other must have an #each_pair method.

entries.name: select { |key, value| block } → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new array of all key-value pairs of the database for which block evaluates to true.

entries.name: shift → (key, value) or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Removes a key-value-pair from this database and returns it as a two-item array [ key, value ]. Returns nil if the database is empty.

entries.name: size → fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the number of key-value pairs in this database.

entries.name: store(key, value) → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Associates the value value with the specified key.

entries.name: sync → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Unless the gdbm object has been opened with the SYNC flag, it is not guaranteed that database modification operations are immediately applied to the database file. This method ensures that all recent modifications to the database are written to the file. Blocks until all writing operations to the disk have been finished.

entries.name: syncmode = boolean → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Turns the database's synchronization mode on or off. If the synchronization mode is turned on, the database's in-memory state will be synchronized to disk after every database modification operation. If the synchronization mode is turned off, GDBM does not wait for writes to be flushed to the disk before continuing.

entries.name: to_a → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array of all key-value pairs contained in the database.

entries.name: to_hash → hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of all key-value pairs contained in the database.

entries.name: update(other) → gdbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Adds the key-value pairs of other to gdbm, overwriting entries with duplicate keys with those from other. other must have an #each_pair method.

entries.name: value?(v) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given value v exists within the database. Returns false otherwise.

entries.name: values → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array of all values of this database.

entries.name: values_at(key, ...) → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array of the values associated with each specified key.
